remarks: The Alexander Subbase Theorem:  If ` B ` is a subbase for the topology ` J ` , and any cover taken from ` B ` has a finite subcover, then the generated topology is compact.  This proof uses the ultrafilter lemma; see ~ alexsubALT for a proof using Zorn's lemma.  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 24-Jan-2010.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Aug-2015.)
statement:
alexsub.1 $e |- ( ph -> X e. UFL ) $.
alexsub.2 $e |- ( ph -> X = U. B ) $.
alexsub.3 $e |- ( ph -> J = ( topGen ` ( fi ` B ) ) ) $.
alexsub.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x C_ B /\ X = U. x ) ) -> E. y e. ( ~P x i^i Fin ) X = U. y ) $.
alexsub $p |- ( ph -> J e. Comp ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d ph x y $.
